Description: Blue glazed composition amulet in the form of Anubis: standing, wearing a wig and a pleated kilt. It is laterally pierced at the back for suspension.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J.H. Taylor and N.C. Strudwick, Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt. Treasures from The British Museum, Santa Ana and London 2005, pp. 114-5, pl. on p. 115.
Bibliographic references: Taylor & Strudwick 2005 / Mummies: Death and the Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (p.114-115)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2002, St Albans, Life and Death 2005-2008, California, The Bowers Museum, Death and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt
